properties.name: A barren open field with some old dirt roads

Prarie crocus, golden bean, bedstraw and sage all conspire to create a momentously boring bike riding area. Set phasars on stunned.

properties.name: Alki Beach
properties.description: Posted by Wept   seattle, waalki beach is a quasi-hidden secret great place. because its in west seattle, most people not in west seattle probably don\'t want to make the trip. it is really quite beautiful, and you have a great view from the beach to downtown from a certain angle, and another great view of some islands and boats and stuff from other angles. it is a bit hipstery and rich in some parts, but it\'s easily ignored. it has a nice bike and/or walking trail alongside the park, and there are some pretty okay restaurants and stuff along the way too. definitely a place to check out. parking can be a nightmare, though.

properties.name: Bicycle Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Austin   706 heliotrope drive, los angeles, ca 90029The Kitchen appreciates donations from the community through out the year. If you can believe it or not, the Kitchen is running low on used parts. If you have some lying around, we ARE interested (pedals, cranks, brakes, seatposts, saddles, brake pads) you name it, we\'ll use it! We are always looking for: road bikes, road brakes and parts, 700c wheels. Also on the wish list: fax/copy/printer for Mac OS. We are also able to accept tax deductible fiscal donations through out the year to help out with our dialy operating costs.

properties.name: Bicyclist tried to break into my car and kill me
properties.description: Posted by Wept  6th & spring, seattle, waI was at a red light, he rode his bike through traffic going the opposite way. He went through the red light toward me, hit my window on his way by, stopped his bike and proceeded to try to break my window and kick in my door. He was totally psycho. I called the cops, they said it happened all the time around there. They also said they probably wouldn\'t catch him. I saw him again that night about a mile away going through a crosswalk. I consider it a good sign that I didn\'t once have an urge to run him over.

properties.name: Crother's Woods
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  The best mountain biking area accessible from downtown Toronto. Many hardcore cyclists have enjoyed this urban green jewel. There are a lot of technical trails hidden away in the trees. The area is also being managed as one of the few remaining Carolinean forests in Southern Ontario so be nice to the trees! I\'ll leave it up to you to find the entrances to the trails.

properties.name: Pedaled my bike from bayview (sf) to see her reunited with her ex
properties.description: Posted by Hive  mill valley, caThought I\'d make a (very) surprise visit by cycling much further than I was really prepared for, and ended up hiding in the bushes outside her house watching an argument between her and her ex (who alse seemed to be into surprise visits). I went to the cafe to call her, no answer, then i see both of them drive past the window. I had a looooong ride home to let that \'crushed\' feeling really settle in.

properties.name: Zooobomb minibike winter olympix
properties.description: Posted by Jason  SE Main & Madison (or thereabouts), Portland, ORWeld longer forks and a big seat post onto a tiny pink kid\'s bike, shave half your skull, assemble en masse along a riverside \'recreational\' bike path and thrash each other with such activities as jousting, bungee-bike tug-o-war and then cheer as a naked reverend rides a bike headlong off a pier into the 40 degree river. This is zoobomb. And a whole clan of likeminded bike and chaos enthusiasts are assembling nationwide! Argh.

properties.name: altered bike route sign

properties.name: citybikes free box
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 1914 se ankeny portland oregonfree box for bike parts, bikes, tires and such

properties.name: citybikes mother shop
properties.description: Posted by Paiges   914 se ankeny st portland oregonthe original shop that started it all. this shop used to be the bicycle repair collective which has now relocated to 46th and belmont. citybikes mother shop is tiny, packed with accesories, parts and tools. a full back room for cheap used parts, the shop also has two stands for outside customer use and a bunch of loaner tools for the public for FREE. but be polite to your mechanic please because this shop is slammed 9 months of the year and the mechanics get a little onry sometimes with the sheer numbers of customers filling up the shop. the BEST in value for bike repair. simply put they do great work for low prices. this shop is full service: basic and deluxe tune-ups light overhauls ( big ones sent down to annex) and custom installations of parts and accesories. check out the flyers posted on the front door for all the cool events that citybike workers are involved in outside of their daily routines.

properties.name: hopeless romantic- middle of ankeny bike path
properties.description: Posted by Paiges tried to steal a boys bike he jumped on my back we tumbled and felli think it was the first night we hung out, or maybe the second. we ate dinner on the floor of the repair shop, listening to kanye west with the disco ball for our only light. we stayed up all night talking. while biking home i suggested we trade bikes and i tried to run off with yours (a joke) you jumped up on my back and we fell over on the ground. you lied and called in sick to work the next day so we could hang out. you never got caught.
